= Components =
(generated)

|| *Component ID* || *Component Name* || *Type* || *Function* || *Comments* ||
|| *VBA.FD.RT* || Retina || 1-order Sensory Nucleus || Spatial decorrelation through center surround inhibition || 100:1 cones/rods to ganglion cells aggregation,<BR>edge extraction ||
|| *VBA.FD.TH.LGN* || Lateral Geniculate Nucleus || Sensory Relay Nucleus || Temporal decorrelation || Only 10% of inputs to LGN come from the retina. 90%<BR>are modulatory inputs from cortex and the brainstem ||
|| *VBA.FD.TH.IPV* || Inferior Pulvinar || Sensory Relay Nucleus || Dorsal =Where= Stream || Thalamus ||
|| *VBA.FD.TH.LPV* || Lateral Pulvinar || Sensory Relay Nucleus || Ventral =What= Stream || Thalamus ||
|| *VBA.FD.TH.MPV* || Medial Pulvinar || Sensory Relay Nucleus || Integration of associative cortical information and projects to<BR>visuomotor-related cortex || CG, PMC, PFC connections ||
|| *VBA.FD.TH.OPV* || Oral Pulvinar || Sensory Relay Nucleus || Somatosensory functions || Thalamus, connected with parietal cortex ||
|| *VBA.MM.SC* || Superior Colliculus || Sensory Control Nucleus || Direct behavioral responses toward specific points in egocentric space, induce<BR>saccadic eye movement || Superficial layers are sensory-related, deep layers<BR>are motor-related ||
|| *VBA.MM.PT.NOT* || Nucleus of Optic Tract || Sensory Relay Nucleus || Encode retinal error information during smooth pursuit eye movements || Guide motor learning during horizontal SP ||
|| *VBA.MM.PT.PON* || Pretectal Olivary Nucleus || Sensory Control Nucleus || Pupillary light reflex and modulating subcortical nuclei involved in circadian<BR>rhythms || Primary visual centre, involved in the pupillary<BR>light reflex, receives retinal input ||
|| *VBA.MM.PT.PR* || Principal Pretectal Nucleus || Sensory Control Nucleus || Pupillary light reflex || Affected by visual cortex and projects to EWN ||
|| *VBA.MM.PT.SL* || Sublentiform Nucleus || Sensory Control Nucleus || Accomodation reflex || Combines visual cortex and retinal input to project<BR>to OCN, receives retinal input ||
|| *VBA.MM.TRH* || Trochlear Nucleus || Motor Relay Nucleus || Change Eye Direction || Muscle nucleus ||
|| *VBA.MM.OCN* || Oculomotor Nucleus || Motor Relay Nucleus || Change Eye Direction || Muscle nucleus ||
|| *VBA.MM.DSCH* || Darkschewitsch Nucleus || Sensory Control Nucleus || Mediate the consensual pupillary light reflex || Light in one eye results in pupil changes in<BR>another eye ||
|| *VBA.HP.ABD* || Abducens Nucleus || Motor Relay Nucleus || Conjugated movements of both eyes || Motoneurons - to muscle, interneurons - to OCN ||
|| *VBA.HM.NPH* || Prepositus Nucleus || Sensory Control Nucleus || Integrate PPRF phasic signal to provide tonic signal of abducens || Part of horizontal gaze holding system ||
